relationship: Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication

comment: "Great, incisive light edit and significant cut for length. They pay $1/word for online/print and .50 for online-only (do not ask me how this is fair, but...) All fact-checking falls to the writer, so be prepared."
"NYT Styles pays very well by NYT standards. But online-only version only pays .50 vs. $1/word for print/online. Very nice, professional, responsive editors."
levelOfReporting: Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication

comment: "Editor came to me to write a "reported think piece." I wrote it; they rejected it. Asked me to "try again," at something completely new, but without any guidance about what that something new would be. Urged me to write something more personal. They rejected that, too. No kill fee."
"editor asked me to write essay. we went back and forth for about two months before they finally ran it on the front of Sunday Review"

comment: ""Sometimes they have a flat rate but generally by the word""
